results.title: Opposites attract
results.creator_credit: Elin Bakken Tonder and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A shy retiring little man and his glamourous neighbour share meaningful looks as they pass each other in the hallway. He is entranced by her ravishing outfits, she is a little lonely and thinks ‘why not?’. But there is a twist in the tale of this claymation. Music by Matt Archer.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Norbert
results.creator_credit: Michael Hill and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Animated ‘fractured fairytale’ story about Norbert, with abnormally big ears, and the prejudices he faces from the local townsfolk. Being different, Norbert soon discovers, means a lonely and alienated life. A rather bleak piece laced with moments of off-beat black humour. Narrated by V J Shanmugam.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Off the rails: memorabilia of the Great Western Railway
results.creator_credit: Mike Slee, David G. Rose, Kathy Rose, Philip Goodhand-Tait and Span Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Story of steam”.
The history of a nation’s progress is the history of her sons’ achievements, their hopes and disappointments, their failures and successes. English history during the past one hundred years provides no finer example of this than the story of that great railway which linked London with the West Country. This documentary traces the history of the Great Western Railway (GWR) through archival footage and stills, and the Great Western Society which was set up around the early 60s by a group of schoolboys. Over the years the members of the Society have collected and restored all manner of memorabilia belonging to or used by the GWR to the point where eventually they established the Small Relics Museum at the Didcot Railway Centre in Oxfordshire. Many examples of these pieces are shown throughout the documentary along with a visit to one of the last GWR signal boxes still working. A must for all those lovers of railways and steam trains. Introduced and narrated by Mike Savage.

results.title: Nigel & Frank meet their matchbox
results.creator_credit: Sam Howie and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A light-hearted animated story of friendship and just how far two old mates will let greed and envy come between them when they discover a magic matchbox. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Just another bump in the road!!!
results.creator_credit: Michelle Carlin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Michelle Carlin loved her job caring for disabled people. It has encouraged her to take a positive outlook on life no matter how much things go wrong and in turn this has helped her through some very tough times.

results.title: New love
results.creator_credit: Jayt Buchanan and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A captivating piece of animation about the wonderment of new love - the hopes and dreams and the possibilities. Dialogue is replaced by the simple flowing of words as they weave in and out and around the lovers. Music score adapted from the track New Love by Cam Butler and Silver Ray.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: The Moment
results.creator_credit: Apid Busayasiri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A young man goes to visit the grave of his grandmother at a remote graveyard on the outskirts of a city. While he is there a series of mysterious events unfold that magically transport him back to his joyful childhood. Hand drawn animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: An Inner passion
results.creator_credit: Hung Lin and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Hand-drawn 2-D animated moral tale of a baker and his assistant and how one person’s passion can inspire and change the actions of their bullying and intolerant boss.
Original music score by James Hodson. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
